New Records: Mikel Merino scored the winning goal in the last minute of extra time, sending Spain to the semi-final of Euro 2024
Key Match Events: Germany was eliminated from Euro 2024 after a 2-1 loss to Spain in the quarter-final match
Niclas Füllkrug hit the post with a header in the 90th minute
Florian Wirtz scored the equalizing goal for Germany in the 89th minute
Mikel Merino scored the winning goal for Spain in the last minute of extra time
Pre-Game Insights: Luis de la Fuente insisted on the similarities between Spain and Germany, both teams employing a high press and the counter-press
Julian Nagelsmann said the match would be 'as interesting as everyone thinks'
Post-Match Reflections: The hosts will ask the same question, from the other side. How? Twice they hit the post and there could been a late penalty too
Germany’s second summer fairy tale is over but Spain’s goes on
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a brutal spectacle with 41 shots and 16 yellow cards, a red card too
The game was decided in the last minute of extra time, with Mikel Merino scoring the winning goal for Spain
Others: The match was a wild, open game with both teams creating chances, but ultimately Spain's steel and determination won out
